understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method that retrieves the batch size fail threshold in kilobytes.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is directly related to the configuration setting 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' which determines the threshold at which a multiple-partition batch will fail. This configuration setting defaults to 50kb, which is 10 times the warn threshold.

config_description: Fail any multiple-partition batch exceeding this value. 50kb (10x warn threshold) by default.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration 'batch_size_fail_threshold_in_kb' is used to determine the threshold at which a multiple-partition batch will fail. It is set to 50kb by default, which is 10 times the warn threshold.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration is triggered whenever a multiple-partition batch is being processed and the size exceeds the specified threshold of 50kb.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of this configuration option is that it helps in preventing large batches from causing performance issues or failures in the system. By setting a threshold, it ensures that only batches within the specified size limit are processed, thus maintaining system stability and performance.
